article_node.title: This Classic Economic Gauge Just Flashed A Crisis-Stage Signal
article_node.summary: The copper‑to‑gold ratio has fallen to its lowest level since March 2020, signaling a sharp shift to risk‑off sentiment and heightened global growth concerns. Copper, a key industrial metal, saw a 13% gain in H1 2025 but collapsed 22% in a single day after President Trump’s July tariff announcement and subsequent clarification. Gold, tracked by SPDR Gold Trust, has outperformed other assets, reflecting safe‑haven demand amid trade‑policy uncertainty.
